    Some review articles on nuclear forces and their renormilization

    Effective field theories

    • R. Machleidt, and D. R. Entem
      Chiral effective field theory and nuclear forces
      Phys. Rep. 503, 1 (2011) article
    • E. Epelbaum, H. -W. Hammer, and Ulf-G. Mei√üner
      Modern theory of nuclear forces
      Rev. Mod. Phys. 81, 1773 (2009) article
    • E. Epelbaum
      Few-nucleon forces and systems in chiral effective field theory
      Prog. Part. Nucl. Phys. 57, 654 (2006) article
    • U. van Kolck
      Effective field theory of nuclear forces
      Prog. Part. Nucl. Phys. 43, 337 (1999) article

    Renormalization methods

    • R. J. Furnstahl, and K. Hebeler
      New applications of renormalization group methods in nuclear physics
      Rep. Prog. Phys. 76, 126301 (2013) article
    • S. K. Bogner, R. J. Furnstahl, and A. Schwenk
      From low-momentum interactions to nuclear structure
      Prog. Part. Nucl. Phys. 65, 94 (2010) article
    • R. Roth, T. Neff, and H. Feldmeier
      Nuclear structure in the framework of the unitary correlation operator method
      Prog. Part. Nucl. Phys. 65, 50 (2010) article
    • D. J. Dean, T. Engeland, M. Hjorth-Jensen, M. P. Kartamyshev, and E. Osnes
      Effective interactions and the nuclear shell-model
      Prog. Part. Nucl. Phys. 53, 419 (2004) article
    • S. K. Bogner, T. T. S. Kuo, and A. Schwenk
      Model-independent low momentum nucleon interaction from phase shift equivalence
      Phys. Rep. 386, 1 (2003) article
    • M. Hjorth-Jensen, T. T. S. Kuo, and E. Osnes
      Realistic effective interactions for nuclear systems
      Phys. Rep. 261, 125 (1995) article
